input:
What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Melanoma of conjunctiva

ROLEPLAY SCRIPT:
YOU ARE A PATIENT: YOU ARE 55 AND YOUR BIOLOGICAL GENDER IS MALE.
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- A dark spot on the iris that has gradually become more noticeable
- A raised lesion (spot) in your eye that appears slightly colored and has grown over the past few weeks
- Blurred vision and occasional visual disturbances, especially when reading or driving
- Changes in the shape of your pupil, which seems slightly irregular now
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION gradually over the past month, and I first noticed the dark spot when I looked in the mirror.
I spend a lot of time outdoors for work and hobbies, and I’ve noticed the lesion seems to be getting bigger, which worries me.
I’ve also been feeling a little more sensitive to bright sunlight lately, and my vision isn’t as sharp as it used to be.
output:
THINKING: I should be honest but also not freak out the doctor. It's probably nothing serious, but I've been noticing some changes in my eye that I can't really explain. I’ve been putting it off because I usual
ANSWER: Well, I noticed this dark spot on my eye, and it’s been getting a little bigger, I think. There’s also this bump that’s appeared and looks kinda different now. My vision’s a bit blurry sometimes, especially when I’m reading or driving, and I’ve started to see spots or flashes that weren’t there before. I spend a lot of time outside, so I thought maybe it was nothing, but now I’m a little worried because it’s been changing and I don’t like how it’s affecting my sight.

My vision’s a bit blurry sometimes, especially when I’m reading or driving, and I’ve started to see spots or flashes that weren’t there before. I spend a lot of time outside, so I thought maybe it was nothing, but now I’m a little worried because it’s been changing and I don’t like how it’s affecting my sight.
